alert.note: Alert for Canadian; Cleveland; Grady; Kingfisher; Lincoln; Logan; McClain; Oklahoma; Payne; Pottawatomie (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 4:18AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Kingfisher, northern Grady, Oklahoma, western Lincoln, Cleveland, Logan, southwestern Payne, eastern Canadian, northwestern Pottawatomie and northwestern McClain Counties through 445 AM CDT... At 418 AM CDT, doppler radar was tracking an area of showers and thunderstorms extending from 4 miles northwest of Langston to near Oklahoma City to 5 miles east of El Reno to 5 miles southwest of Minco. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Oklahoma City, Norman, Edmond, Moore, Midwest City, Shawnee, Del City, El Reno, Guthrie, Newcastle, Blanchard, Chandler, Yukon, Bethany, Mustang, Choctaw, Warr Acres, The Village, Noble, and Tuttle. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 104 and 168. Interstate 40 between mile markers 125 and 185. Interstate 44 between mile markers 91 and 167. Interstate 240 between mile markers 1 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Canadian; Cleveland; Grady; Kingfisher; Lincoln; Logan; McClain; Oklahoma; Payne; Pottawatomie
